detaileddescription.para: Role of a stack
Stack object.
A Stack represents a collection of one or more communication layers/elements connected to each other and managed as a single unit.

The elements are logically layered from 'bottom' to 'top', where the 'bottom' layer is typically logically closest to the 'transport' side of the stack and the 'top' layer is logically closest to the 'application' side of the stack.

Each element in a stack has one or two I/O ports that can be internally connected to other elements in the same stack and/or exposed to users of the stack so that they may be used directly or connected to other data sources/sinks.

Stacks may be connected on their top and bottom sides as applicable, to communication elements like transport sources/sinks, application source/sinks, as well as sources/sinks from other stacks (for example, one may create two stack objets and connect them together to form a larger stack).
Stack objects listen for events from the elements they create and hold, and forward some of those events to their listener, if any.
Stack element type identifier. See GG_STACK_ELEMENT_TYPE_XXX constants
Stack element identifier.
Stack port identifier.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *descriptor, const GG_StackBuilderParameters *parameters, size_t parameter_count, GG_StackRole role, const GG_StackIpConfiguration *ip_configuration, GG_Loop *loop, GG_DataSource *source, GG_DataSink *sink, GG_Stack **stack)
memberdef.name: GG_StackBuilder_BuildStack

detaileddescription.para: Build a stack.
Depending on the stack that is requested, the caller may pass construction parameters and/or an IP configuration when non-default values are needed.

parameterdescription.para: A descriptor that uniquely identifies the stack that is requested.
Pointer to an array of element construction parameters.
Number of entries in the parameters array.
Role that this stack should assume.
IP Configuration for the stack, or NULL to let the stack builder decide.
Loop in which the stack will run.

Data source to connect the bottom of the stack to, or NULL if not applicable. NOTE: when this parameter is not NULL, the stack builder will connect that source to the bottom element of the stack, but not keep a reference to that object. It is the responsibility of the caller to disconnect that source from the stack before destroying the stack.
Data sink to connect the bottom of the stack to, or NULL if not applicable.
[out] Pointer to the variable where the built stack will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the stack could be built, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Destroy/teardown a stack
Start a stack.
Starting a stack should be done after the stack has been built and the user of the stack is ready for data to start flowing through the stack.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the stack could be started, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Reset a stack.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the stack could be reset, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Get the event emitter interface of a stack.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: The GG_EventEmitter interface for the object.

detaileddescription.para: Get the event listener interface of a stack.
That interface allows sending events directly to the stack.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: The GG_EventEmitter interface for the object.

detaileddescription.para: Get the inspectable interface of a stack.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: The GG_Inspectable interface for the object.

detaileddescription.para: Get the IP information associated with a stack, if any.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if an IP configuration can be returned for the stack, or GG_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED if the stack does not have any IP configuration.

detaileddescription.para: Get the status for the DTLS element of the stack, if there is one.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to the struct where the status will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the stack has a DTLS element and its status could be obtained, GG_ERROR_NO_SUCH_ITEM if the stack does not have a DTLS element, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Get I/O interfaces for a stack element.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Id of the element that owns the port. A virtual element ID constants may be used.
Id of the port to get within the element.
[out] Address of the struct in which the port info will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the port exists, or GG_ERROR_NO_SUCH_ITEM if it doesn't.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of elements in a stack.

simplesect.para: The number of elements in the stack.

detaileddescription.para: Get an element by index. This may be used, for example, to iterate over all the elements in a stack. The elements in a stack are ordered from top to bottom, so the top-most element is at index 0.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Index of the element to get (0-based).
[out] Address of the struct in which the element info will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the requested element exits in the stack, or a GG_ERROR_NO_SUCH_ITEM.

briefdescription.para: Virtual element ID for the top-most element of a stack.
Virtual element ID for the bottom-most element of a stack.
Port at the top side of an element.
Port at the bottom side of an element.

detaileddescription.para: Stack with only a Gattlink element.

Element Configuration parameters:
GG_StackElementGattlinkParameters (optional, omit for defaults)

Construction parameters:
source, sink (required)
Stack with Gattlink and a Network Interface

Construction parameters:
source, sink (required)
ip_configuration (optional, pass NULL for defaults)

Construction parameters:
source, sink (required)
ip_configuration (optional, pass NULL for defaults)

Element Configuration parameters:

GG_TlsServerOptions (required in Server mode, omit in Client mode)
GG_TlsClientOptions (required in Client mode, omit in Server mode)

Construction parameters:
source, sink (required)
ip_configuration (optional, pass NULL for defaults)
Stack with a UDP socket and DTLS

Element Configuration parameters:
GG_StackElementDatagramSocketParameters (optional, omit for defaults)
GG_TlsServerOptions (required in Server mode, omit in Client mode)
GG_TlsClientOptions (required in Client mode, omit in Server mode)

Construction parameters:
ip_configuration (optional, pass NULL for defaults)
Stack with just a Network Interface

para.preformatted: +~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~+ | IP | (not exposed as a stack element) +~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~+ {internal communication} +----------------------------+ | Network Interface ('neti') | +----------------------------+ [source] [sink]
